thread.title: Cheap travel deals in the countdown to Xmas
thread.title_full: Cheap travel deals in the countdown to Xmas

author: Robyn Ironside
title: Cheap travel deals in the countdown to Xmas
text:
Video Image Save money when travelling overseas 2:05 Four ways to reduce the cost of your holiday
August 13th 2015 2 months ago /video/video.news.com.au/Lifestyle/Money/ High flying ... airfares typically soar in the countdown to Christmas.
Robyn Ironside News Corp Australia Network BOOKING overseas flights is best done well in advance but all is not lost for those who have left arrangements to the last minute.
Data provided by travel search engine Skyscanner shows travellers who booked flights from Sydney to Los Angeles last Christmas scored a 20 per cent discount ten days before they flew.
But the opposite was true for anyone making a last minute dash to Bangkok, with fares soaring by 70 per cent in the festive season.
Getaway ... Savvy travellers can still bag a bargain leading up to Christmas. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
Melburnians heading to Auckland managed to bag a bargain just a few days before Christmas with prices dropping five per cent.
And Brisbane residents got the best deals two weeks before the big day on flights to Manila and New Zealand.
Skyscanner prepared the data to show there are still good fares to be found in the ten weeks leading up to the festive period.
Good deal ... New Zealand offers affordable deals for Aussies. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
Country Marketing Manager for Oceania, Natasha Bath, said it was common for flight prices to fluctuate due to the sophisticated price management systems used by airlines to ensure their planes were full.
“What we’ve done is to identify the patterns that could help travellers find the best time to book by analysing the prices paid by travellers last year as an indication,” Ms Bath said.
“If dates are flexible, search by “month view” to identify the days where fares are lowest, or try searching “everywhere” and choose from a list of destinations sorted by price.”
Although flights are generally unaffected by the Australian dollar’s fluctuations, hotel rates are a different story.
Quandary ... Cheap flights may be available to LA but hotel rates are soaring. Picture: California Travel & Tourism Commission Source: Supplied
Analysis undertaken by Hotels.com shows the average rate for a five-star hotel soared to $650 in LA and $594 in New York.
The best deal for Aussies was in Warsaw, Poland, where a top-end hotel could be booked for $143 a night, followed by Brussels in Belgium, for $191 a night.
Berlin was third, followed by Bangkok, Budapest, Delhi, Guangzhou, Lisbon, Mumbai and Istanbul with rates under $250 a night.
Bargains galore ... Warsaw in Poland has the cheapest five-star hotel rates in the world for Aussies. Picture: News Corp Australia Source: News Corp Australia
Hotels.com regional director Katherine Cole said it was clear travellers could still enjoy premier accommodation on a shoestring budget.
“While travellers may find they don’t have as much spending power as they did a year ago, they’ll be pleased to know that there are exotic destinations to visit that won't break the bank,” Ms Cole said.
Holiday pricing ... where the best savings were made in 2014 Source: Supplied
